deck_excerpt: Combo heavy earth-based deck with different ways to break your opponents board.
deck_description: I was inspired for this deck by a Youtube video called "Earth Toolbox 2019". It featured a going 1st deck with different earth-engines to stun the opponent. I thought about some more cards, that could fit into this deck and ended up on a going 2nd strategie with some changes to the original deckbuild. Ofc this is no competetive deck, but for Rogue matchups it works pretty well. Here is a description of the engins and support cards: Rock-Engine: One good winning condition is the Block Dragon, that searches us two lvl-4 rock-monsters to go into Utopia Double. As targets i choose 3 Gigantes and one The Rock Spirit, because they can be specialed easily. Lapis is the target for Brillant Fusion and for Rescue Rabit. Insect-Engine: The main reason for this is Gokipole, that can search and special a normal insect monster and remove one Monster from the field without targeting or destroying. To trigger its effect, we got mill cards, i.e. Resonance Insect, wich can also search Kaijus or Doom Dozer. So we got one more removal and XYZ/Link-Material. Combo Starter/Extender: Mathmatician and Rescue Rabit are good normal summons that start our combos. We can enable the Insect-engine by milling Gokipole, get extenders like Dotscaper or Glow-up Bulb into the graveyard or just go into a Rank 4. Gallis is a free potential special summon and can mill more combo pieces. Going-2nd-cards: Pankratops and Kaijus to remove opponents monsters. Spells: These are combo starter/extender. Kaiju Slumber ofc is a removal and search tool and Double or Nothing is needed for winning with Utopia Double. Extra Deck: Can be chanced depending on the opponent or meta. Curious is an important combo piece to mill specific cards. Saryuja can be used to draw more cards while using weak monsters for the link summon. Bagooska is a nice Going-1st card and Granite can search our Block Dragon. You can add any Link-4 monster you want, Borrelsword works perfectly in this, but its a bit more expensive.

deck_excerpt: Ritual and Fusion focused Deck with strong disruptions.
deck_description: I tried to make a playable Lord of Red - Deck. The card itself isn't bad, you can destroy up to two of your opponents cards in either players turn. The problem was, that playing rituals wasn't that consistent and you were out of resources if your board got broken. With all the support that Rituals got (Pre-prep, Impcantations) it's possible, to get to your Ritual pieces easier. Now the Lord of Red enters the field nearly every turn. What Ritual decks usually don't use, is the Extra Deck. I thought that was a waste of potential. Sure, the Invoked-Engine is nothing very innovative, but so we got an easy way to use our Extra Deck, just by normal summoning Aleister the Invoker. With Aleister and the Impcantations we got the Fusion materials for Mechaba and Caliga, Lord of Red and Ash Blossom are perfect for Purgatrio. At some time you may have to decide, whether to normal Aleister or Manju. Both cards can get one engine going on their own, so i wouldnt cut any of these. Another Extra Deck option is the Super Polymerisation, primary to get rid of your opponents monsters. Superpoly-targets depend on the meta. Diabolos is a nice tech card. It can be specialed when we tribute the Impcantations for the Ritual summon of Lord of Red. If an Aleister is on field, we can also use Diabolos effect to make our opponent lose one card in his hand. In the end I got a searchheavy and consistent fun deck, that is nice for going first, as well going second. Ratios for Impcantations and handtraps can be chanced for personal preferences. For going second BLS is a good option, because the Impcantations are Light and Dark attribute monsters. Called by the grave secures our searchpower. Even if Aleister or the Impcantations get stopped by a handtrap, Pre-preparation or Rites is a one-card Ritual summon. Pot of Desires should be activated AFTER searching the combo pieces. Hornet Drones gives us a one-card Link summon of Aleister the Invoker of Madness or another generic Link monster.   If you got an idea how to make this deck better, please leave it down in the comments.

Flip-Effect based swarm Deck to go on your opponents nerves ;)
deck_description: Krawler is a flip-effect-based Insect-Deck that was introduced in Circuit Break. The goal is to force your opponent to triggert the float-effects of your Krawlers to consistently generate advantage and swarm the field with Insect-Monsters. All your lvl-2-Krawlers let you special summon 2 other Krawlers from your Deck if they leave the field by an opponents card effect. The Link-Monsters also float by reviving two Krawlers from your Graveyard when they leave the field by nearly any reason. Duels with Krawlers can take a long time, but if you „survive“ the first wave of your opponents card effect, you have decent chances to win the match. The Deck is absolutely not meta relevant, but against other Fun/Rogue Decks it can be pretty solid. Many Decks struggle against float-heavy strategies and don’t have an out for it. BTW I have a high win rate against Pendulum Decks, I don’t really know why, but it works. Best counters to this Deck are backrow-removal-cards (Twin Twister, Cosmic Cyclone,…) and graveyard-blocking (Abyss Dweller, Necrovalley,…). Also Utopia The Lightning is perfect, because he stops Krawlers activating their effects while its attack. Here I’ll show you my Main Deck choices and give a short description. The variant shown is a pure Deck, that is not ment to be an Anti-Strategy. If you prefer palying flootgates, Superpolymerisation or anything else you can go for these cards too.   3x Krawler Spine, Receptor and Glial: These are imo the most important Krawlers. They destroy monsters, search new Krawlers and special them from your hand or graveyard. I wouldnt play less than 3 each.   2x Krawler Axon, Dentrite and Deus Ex: They are used to destroy spells/traps, mill monsters (not only Krawler!) and shut down your opponents monster effects. Deus doesn’s have the swarm effect, but is a walking skill drain for your opponents monster effects and a winning condition on its own. These three are situational, so i prefer playing only 2.   1x Krawler Ranvier: Can be good in grind game, because he let’s you recycle dead Krawlers. You don‘t want to draw him turn one, so 1 is enough   2x Block Spider: One more swarming tool. One spider specials another spider when specialed. These two could brick if you draw both or banish one with pot of desires, but imo thats fine. Usually this is a two-card Link-option. Can be sided or cut if necessary.   1x Glow up Bulb: You want to mill it with Dentrite. Swarming tool and gives you the option for Naturia Beast.   Spells: 3x World Legacy in Shadow: Let’s you swarm more insects (also enables the Block Spider) and removals your opponents attacking monsters without targeting or destroying. You don’t necessarily need terraforming, cause it’s already searchable. If you play against krawlers, try to out this card before you go into battle phase!   3x World Legacy Survivor: Basically the best card of your Deck. You reveal the Top 5 cards of your deck, add one („Krawler-“ or „World Legacy“-Card) and mill the rest. Perfect for setup your graveyard.   3x Worm Bait and Scapegoat: Token-generate-cards that can both be used for Link summoning. I prefer playing as much as possible, because they are not searchable and could be milled by Survivor or banished with Pot of Desires.   1x One for one: Enables the Block Spiders/Glow up Bulb. Could be sides/cut.   2x Pot of Desires: We play enough Krawlers and don’t have „That“ key card we could accidently banish, so it’s a free plus 1.   Traps: 3x World Legacy Pawns: You want to see this card first turn! Let’s you flip your Krawlers face up/down to activate their flip effects. You can also bait your opponent if he activates cards with removal effects. Just flip one random Krawler face up and his swarm effect will be triggered.   3x World Legacy‘s Mind Melt: Forces your opponent to removal your face-up Krawler and triggert he swarm effect. Also specials a Krawler from your Deck into a zone a Link-Monster points to.   3x Lost Wind: Effect negation, ATK-manipulator and can be recycled if you mill it with survivor.   Crusadia Krawler and World Legacy - World Armor work perfectly with this deck, but they are situational and can brick. So I decided to cut them from the deck. They are still a good option, maybe instead of the block spiders.   One thing to the X-Krawler Link-Monsters: I prefer playing only one Qualiark. Its „good“ effects can nearly never be used and I like to have more space for Extra Deck options. First turn it’s fine to go into Synapsis or Neurogos, even if they don’t point down to any Monster Zone. Important is the swarming effect, and all X-Krawler share the same. Usually you won’t be able to special more Extra deck Monsters (Linkuriboh + Synapsis is a „solid“ first turn opening) and your opponent will destroy your X-Krawler anyway. The rest of the Extra Deck is personal preference, you can play whatever you want. Same for the Side Deck, here I show just some thoughts.

deck_excerpt: Another way to utilize Thunder Dragons, aiming for the card advantage while fusion summoning during your opponent's turn using Chain Material! Fun and
deck_description:
Thunder dragon deck is one of the best deck in current format. Its pure version is specialized in fusion summoning while spewing out some generic link monster. This deck will take the pure version with different approach while maintaining the real deck consistency. While MR5 format boosts this deck playstyle, the new banlist hurts this deck consistency, so I have to put this in non-meta category.

For starter we need to get chain material (the most important, lets u fusion summon using main deck as material) and necro fusion (generic fusion trap). Chain material bypasses the "..banish the material from gy face down.." on necro fusion, so any material will be monster from main deck, hand, and/or gy banished face-up. It means any thunder dragon banished effect (3 monster effects if u fusion titan) will trigger during ur opponent's turn, maximizing the card advantage for thunder dragon. To do this, cards like lilith (searches both chain material and necro fusion) and trap trick (searches both, but shouldnt be used to search chain material cus it limits u to only use one trap after trap trick resolved).

The remaining main deck cards are just basic thunder dragon package cards (including aloof lupine, batteryman solar, allure of darkness, and gold sarc). Support cards like impermanence (handtrap, another trap trick target) and ash blossom (handtrap) are great to boost this deck.

Extra deck: thunder dragons, clotheep (gives free below lv4 monster after u ss fusion monster), predap anaconda (lets u use thunder dragon fusion from deck while dumping the card to gy), and linkuriboh (opens up extra zone using thunder dragonmatrix) are essential. The rest are just good generic link monster.

deck_excerpt: Pretty fun low Tier/Rogoue Deck with combo potential.
deck_description:
The goal ist to set up a board with up to 4 disruptions first turn and win the game with high-ATK monsters. The deck is pretty consistent because it has many search effects included.

Some monsters can be summoned easier, if there is already a “Photon/Galaxy”-Monster on your side of the field. So its important to get any monster on board without using your normal summon.

For the extra Deck you can play nearly all Rank 4/8 XYZ, as well as a variety of Link Monsters. In this profile I only show my selection.

The Side Deck can be filled with backrow removal, floodgates, handtraps and other “Galaxy“-cards

Here a short description for the Main Deck cards:

Galaxy-Eyes Photon Dragon:

Important for Rank 8. Summoning/Effect-Condition for some other cards, especially because he got the „Photon“ and „Galaxy“ in its name. The own effect is nearly irrelevant.

 

Galaxy Knight:

Most important normal summon and a one-card-Rank 8. Can be searched, so i advise to play only 2 copies to avoid bricky hands, playing 3 is also possible (especially when also playing Pot of Desires)

 

Galaxy Brave:

Free special summon, requires a „Photon“-Monster in hand. Material for Rank 8 or Rank 4, also can be a good beatstick. Hard once per turn, so I only play 2.

 

Galaxy Soldier:

Searches all „Galaxy“-Monsters. Discard the Photon Dragon for the effect of Galaxy Knight. Soldier is also an easy way to Cyber Dragon Infinity.

 

Galaxy Wizard:

Also a normal summon. Searches any „Galaxy“-Card. Great combo extender, but normal summoning him may conflict with the Knight. You can also play 1 or 3 copies if you want to.

 

Galaxy Cleric:

Good card for turn 2/3. Recycles cards and lets you draw 2. Can be sided out if necessary (or cut completely).

 

Photon Vanisher:

Free Special Summon when you control any „Photon/Galaxy“-Monster. Searches the Photon Dragon and is perfect material for a Rank 4 or Link.

 

Photon Advancer:

Also a free special summon for a rank 4 or Link, but needs a „Photon“-Monster on field. I prefer him instead of Photon Thrasher, because Trasher usually bricks after turn 1. Playing Thrasher is still an option you may consider in your build.

 

Photon Orbital:

Most important searcher in the deck. Can search any „Galaxy/Photon“-Monster. Is also an equip for ATK boost and battle protection.

 

Spells:

Photon Sanctuary

2 Photon-Tokens, free Solflare Dragon, no once per turn…nothing more to say

 

Galaxy Expedition:

Summons one high-lvl Monster from your deck. Great combo extender. I advise definitely playing a playset.

 

Galaxy Trance:

Also a great combo extender or comeback card, but needs graveyard setup and blocks you from summoning Cyber Dragon Infinity. Playing a playset is possible, but not necessary imo.

 

Galaxy Zero:

Searchable Monster Reborn.

 

Reinforcement of the army:

For searching Vanisher and Advancer.

 

Monster Reborn:

Monster Reborn  ;)

 

Called by the grave:

We got many searches and combos, so we have to protect us from handtraps. Can also be an interruption in your opponents turn.

 

Trade In:

Draw power. We play many lvl 8. We can easy discard the Photon Dragon for Knight’s effect.

 

Tachyon transmigration

One more negation for all your opponents effects in one chain. Needs a Galaxy-Eye Monster on our field to be activated. Can also be sided out or bumped to 3.

So here's the problem I had during the November 2019 format: I was living on my own at University with none of my collection on me but I really wanted to play Yugioh at locals and attend an upcoming Regional in my area, so I decided to build a Zombie Deck using just the Zombie Horde Structure Deck cards. At locals I did just kinda okay with it, but for the Regional I wanted a much better list.

So I went ahead and bought more structure decks: This time I got cards from Order of the Spellcasters and Rokket Revolt and built this list for the upcoming regional. My final result of that regional was 69th place (out of 105-ish players) with 2 wins, 2 losses and 3 draws.

So if you're looking for a super budget Zombie Deck to build, the entire main deck can be purchased for roughly $40 and the Extra Deck only really needs Red-Eyes Zombie Necro Dragon which you can get from the Structure Deck also.
My regional list did use a Side Deck and much larger Extra deck with the cards that I had at the time, but I barely used anything from my Extra Deck and the Side Deck is completely up to you if you want to construct one.

deck_excerpt: Harpie Lady and Simorgh Teamwork!
deck_description: Hello viewers. Today's deck features the Harpie Ladies combined with the Simorghs, both whom are Winged Beasts. The overall goal of this deck is that by the end of your turn, you'll have a field with a high-level Winged Beast such as Simorgh, Lord of the Storm, or will have Simorgh, Bird of Kings ready. Harpies play an assisting role in getting everything set up, and the Simorghs play the result. COMBOS: "Harpie Channeler" + "Harpie Perfumer" + "Elegant Egotist": Summon Harpie Channeler first. Then use her effect to Special Summon Perfumer. From there, use Perfumer's effect to add Elegant Egotist (if not in your hand). Finally, use Elegant Egotist to Special Summon a Harpie Lady or Sisters (most likely Sisters). From there, you can Link Summon into Simorgh, Bird of Kings or any other Link Monster (or Utopia). "Simorgh, Bird of Calamity" + "Simorgh, Bird of Bringing" + "Elborz, the Sacred Lands of Simorgh": (can only be done if your opponent's S&T Zone is empty) Activate Elborz. Summon Calamity, then use the effect to send Bringing to the Graveyard. Activate Bringing's effect to SS itself from the Graveyard. Elborz's effect will allow you to summon another Winged Beast while you control a Winged Beast. Tribute the two to Summon Simorgh Storm or Apex. "Wynn the Wind Medium" + "Simorgh, Bird of Calamity" + "Elborz, the Sacred Lands of Simorgh"+ "Mist Valley Apex Avian" + "Simorgh of Darkness": Activate Wynn's effect from the hand and discard any WIND monster to search for Calamity. Normal Summon Calamity and use its effect to send Darkness to the Graveyard. Activate Elborz and use its 1st effect and reveal Apex. Then, use 2nd effect to tribute Calamity for Apex. Darkness's effect will trigger and will allow you to SS itself. "Divine Wind of Mist Valley" + "Harpie Dancer" + "Harpie Perfumer": Activate Divine Wind first. Then, Normal Summon Dancer. Use Dancer's effect to return herself to the hand and summon herself again (or another WIND Monster). Then use Divine Wind's trigger effect to SS Perfumer. Activate Perfumer to add Elegant Egotist and use it to SS Sisters. From there, you can Link Summon into Simorgh, Bird of Kings. (more combos exist, but that is up to you to find out :) NOTE:  To be able to thoroughly use Simorghs effectively, it is best to make sure your opponent has no Spells or Traps in their S&T Zone. This can be done with Repulsion or Trunade. Borreload Savage Dragon and Hop Ear Squadron are included in the Side Deck in case you'd like to throw a Synchro into the Deck. I placed a 2nd Harpie Lady Sisters in the Side because of space and to avoid bricks. It can be switched with any card in the deck if you think it works best when runned on two. If your planning on summoning the Simorgh Link Monster, its best you go first. Otherwise going first or second is fine. One of the combos above allows you to go to Utopia (probably already mentioned). That is also up to you.   Any comments or suggestions are appreciated. Thanks and Enjoy the Deck :)

deck_excerpt: Fun deck for duels with adjusted rules. Slow progress, with big potential.
deck_description:
This deck is basically made to counter annoying cards like Chaos Ancient Gear Giant , Blue-Eyes Chaos MAX Dragon , Evil HERO Malicious Bane . This deck has a actually slow proegress, you have to survive 3-8 turns, depending on your starting hand, to actually get into the fun part. You have like 2 different main strategy stages. But before that, you actually have to get your key cards on the field or at least into the graveyard. Through cards like Armageddon Knight, Foolish Burial or especially Dark Grepher you can fill your GY with Yubel (1st form) and Diabolos, Lord of the Lair. First stage/strategy: You have Yubel and Lair of Darkness on your field. Your opponent can't attack you, better said shouldn't. You can crosstribute once a turn through effects of Ahrima, the wicked Warden, Diabolos or Yubel with the effect of Lair of Darkness. The effects of Lair also apply for Hand of Nephthys and you can also get rid of annoying monsters with Super Polymerisation because as long as Lair is on the field every face-up monster becomes Dark. Caution! In your end phase you can decide in what order you can activate the effect of Yubel, Yubel - Terrorincarnation and Lair of Darkness. Done right you shouldn't worry about potential threads of the tokens (piercing damage) or a thin wall of indestructable monsters. Second stage/strategy: If you have Yubel - Terrorincarnation on your field, and the most annoying monster of the enemy are tributed or used as fusion materials, your next goal should be to summon at least 1 Sacred Phoenix of Nephthys. This whole loop should be self explaining and already known. Just read the effects of those 2 monsters. Useful information:
  1. You should be cautios about the effect chaining, because occasionally, because of the ruling, there won't be an opportunity, to special summon the next form of Yubel. Quick example: Your opponent plays a Thunder Dragon deck. Yubel's effect activates, your opponent chains an Quick Effect discarding a monster from the hand (Thunder Dragondark) and chains the effect of Thunder Dragon Titan. Yubel is destroyed but that wasn't the last action in the chain - there won't be an opportunity to special summon Yubel - Terrorinc.
  2. The hand traps should be adjusted to the enemy's deck - if you know what he is playing.
  3. You should always have a really good and fast start if you play with customized rules (fun duels) - e.g. 6 cards in starting hand/2 per draw.
  4. Deep Dark Trap Hole can't be used if a XYZ is summoned, because they don't have a common rank/level (it's an XYZ level).
  5. If you have the chance or want to expand the deck with banned cards I'd recommend at least 3x Pot of Greed and Noble Charity.
  6. This deck has currently no possibility to negate effects of face-up monsters and cards.
  7. You can use Last Turn (banned) as a last resort, if you have one of the Yubels on the field, because as soon as the opponent attacks, Yubel is inflicting effect damage and not battle damage. Just be aware of the fact that without Yubel - The Ultimate Nightmare it will most of the time and in a draw, if the opponent's life points won't hit 0. The rulings of Last Turn are long and complicated: Rulings of Last Turn.
Have fun and I'd appreciate some feedback ;)

The Subterror Guru Engine is reduced, but does a very good job of Stalling and can single-handedly win you the Game in a good Matchup. Eater of Millions and Gizmek Oroshi consistently banish lots of cards and remove enemy monsters. Necroface can come in clutch and win you the game with your back against the wall. I am still thinking about cutting it. Pot of Desires is the perfect draw spell to run in a Gren Maju Deck, nuff said. Pot of Extravagance is at one because I need a lot of my Extra Deck, still the Tradeoff (Extra Deck Strength -> Momentum) is often very much worth it. Super Polymerization is amazing at removing Enemy Monsters so I dedicated most of my Extra Deck to it for maximum removal coverage. An effectively resolved Ghost Reaper is going to win you the Game in a lot of cases that's why i put it in. Foolish Burial is a turbo for Gizmek Orochi. Have fun driving your friends up the wall. deck_excerpt: Maintain board dominance with Secret Village of the Spellcasters and using your Majespecter monsters against your opponent until Unchained Abomination
deck_description: You will only need 1 battle phase to kill your opponent. This is achieved by having, in terms of monsters, your final board: 3 Majespecter monsters, Borrelsword Dragon, and Unchained Abomination. 90% of the time, these will be direct attacks due to the power of your Majespecter Spell/Trap cards keeping your opponent's monsters at bay. This is usually reached by turn 2 or early turn 3, but turn 1 your board will most likely be partially full of aggressive backrow. Majespecter Supercell is your key card. It recycles 5 of your Majespecter cards from your GY into the Deck, then draws a card for you. It also protects any Majespecter cards activated on your field from being negated, this also grants protection against cards like Dark Ruler No More and Skill Drain, even Destiny HERO Plasma. It can also trick your opponent into using one of their negations, essentially wasting it since this card is active. The trick to using this card, chain it with a Majespecter Spell/Trap card. Your opponent will negate the first card, then the effect of Supercell will cancel it and therefore baiting out a free negate. Supercell 95% of the time will become a destruction target, though, so be careful. Ties of the Brethren is an excellent card, as it can basically special summon 2 Majespecter monsters from your Deck. White Wing Magician is also a card target, since all of them are WIND Spellcaster-type monsters that are level 4 (except for Nekomata and Raccoon). The best way to use this is by targeting a Yata, Kybui, or Ogama. Majesty's Pegasus is a 1 or 2 turn useful Field Spell. Most of the time, you will need to use it to special summon Bunbuku from the Deck to add another Majespecter monster. DO THIS, as you can search either a low scale or high scale monster you need to make your scale set.  Once you have at least 2 or 3 Majespecter monsters, you can easily replace this with Secret Village of the Spellcasters to lock your opponent out of using Spell cards. All Majespecter monsters have target and destruction immunity from your opponent. Use this to your advantage! You'll NEVER have to worry about cards such as Cyber Dragon Infinity, Kozmo Dark Destroyer, etc any monster that has an effect that allows them to target or destroy your Majespecter monsters. Additionally, monsters that can negate card effects are also a careless factor, as long as you have Majespecter Supercell active! Unchained Abomination is your boss monster. ALWAYS go into this card with I:P Maquerena and give it destruction immunity. This can be done easily by using 2 monsters to summon her, then her plus 2 others to summon Unchained Abomination. You can also even do this BEFORE pendulum summoning, as usually your opponent own't have any monsters *cough* Tornado... *cough* Tempest.. *cough* that can beat over yours. (Masquerena can also Link summon during your opponent's Main Phase, consider this if you want) Majespecter Tempest is your searchable Solemn Strike. Use Kyubi and Ogama's effects to search/set this card to your field. This card is your FREE Solemn Strike that can be searched up to 3 times per turn (+ Nekomata's effect). Turn 1, you want at least 1 or 2 copies of this card in your backrow, which is highly possible. (If you use Ties of the Brethren on Yata or White Wing Magician, summon both Kyubi and Ogama to get these cards easily). Be very careful of anything that changes monster type and/or attributes on the field. Majespecters HEAVILY rely on them being themselves, as all their Spell/Trap cards require a WIND Spellcaster-type monster to be tributed in order to activate. This means cards such as Zombie World, Buster Dragon, both DNA Trap cards, Lair of Darkness, etc can instantly shut down your offense. Try to use Solemn Judgement very wisely, and don't forget to use Phoenix or Unicorn from the Extra Deck to rid any problems cards should they show up. Grave of the Super Ancient Organism is pretty much self-explanatory. It stops all level 6 or higher special summoned monsters on the field from attacking or using their effects. This card stuns many popular monsters such as Rainbow Neos, Blue-Eyes Chaos MAX Dragon, D/D/D Abyss King Ragnarok, etc. Even fully stunning decks such as Odd-Eyes, Blue-Eyes, Red-Eyes, HEROES. All Majespecter monsters are levels 4 and 3, plus your big monsters are Link monsters. Use this card once its absolutely necessary, as you still have the potential to summon Quintet Magician and wipe your opponent's board before you activate it, as it effects ALL monsters, not just your opponent's. By turn 2 or turn 3, your board will consist of the following, and this is your IDEAL winning board: Secret Village of the Spellcasters - 3 Majespecter monsters, Unchained Abomination, Borrelsword Dragon - Majespecter Supercell(active), 2 Majespecter Tempest, Majespecter Tornado, Majespecter Cyclone. Your attack will be using Borrelsword Dragon's effect on a Majespecter monster, switching it to Defense position and gaining itself a second attack. For a total of 6000, finish your opponent with Unchained Abomination for the final 3000 blow.   ~This is an MR3-based deck. It can still be powerful in MR4, but will be more difficult to achieve~

deck_excerpt: Go through your deck in one turn
deck_description:
Do  I really need to explain it?..okay I will then Okay so how this works is
  • You find a way to activate appropriate when your opponent draws a card not during their draw phase
  • You just spam cards that allow your opponent to draw cards while you draw 2 cards depending on how many appropriate trap cards are active
  • And then you win.. Simple as that
However Getting Appropriate in your hand on your first turn is a rather slim chance of 3/40 so you make the calculation. And activating it is another tough task so how can you speed things up? You stall Mystic Mine is your best friend when it comes to this deck as many duelists out there focus more on monster effects rather than destroying traps and spells Mystic Mine is pretty much the child of Swords of Revealing Light and Skill Drain and it takes this one card to completely shut down your opponent There are two ways to activate Appropriate in this deck,you either
  • Wait for your opponent to activate a spell or trap and negate it with Dark Bribe
  • Force your opponent to draw two cards using either cup of ace(Pray for it to land on tails) or Gift of greed
and after that you are free to activate other draw cards like Dark World Dealings and Hand Destruction to draw out your entire deck Word of Advice
  • I usually use 2 appropriates on the field to draw out cards on a much faster rate. Using three of them is overkill as two appropriates is more than enough
  • Becareful when using a deck like this because you will run into duels where instead of winning by the effects of Exodia, You deck out yourself on accident by the on going effect of appropriate to draw 2 cards.
  • But in all honesty, I just love the sight of drawing so many cards in a single turn so I sometime use 3 of them at the same time occasionally
In conclusion The deck is pretty fun to play with as I usually play it for casual duels when I am not into serious mode. I know there are other more efficient Exodia decks out there but drawing cards until you have about 30 cards in your hand is pretty funny to me.  The deck is not easy to set up but hey...who said life was easy anyway?
